Register.description: Cache control
Register.name: CTRL

BitField.description:
When 1, the cache memories are powered down. They retain state,
 but can not be accessed. This reduces static power dissipation.
 Writing 1 to this bit forces CTRL_EN to 0, i.e. the cache cannot
 be enabled when powered down.
 Cache-as-SRAM accesses will produce a bus error response when
 the cache is powered down.
BitField.name: POWER_DOWN

BitField.description:
When 1, writes to any alias other than 0x0 (caching, allocating)
 will produce a bus fault. When 0, these writes are silently ignored.
 In either case, writes to the 0x0 alias will deallocate on tag match,
 as usual.
BitField.name: ERR_BADWRITE

BitField.description:
When 1, enable the cache. When the cache is disabled, all XIP accesses
 will go straight to the flash, without querying the cache. When enabled,
 cacheable XIP accesses will query the cache, and the flash will
 not be accessed if the tag matches and the valid bit is set.

 If the cache is enabled, cache-as-SRAM accesses have no effect on the
 cache data RAM, and will produce a bus error response.
BitField.name: EN

Register.description: Cache Flush control
Register.name: FLUSH

BitField.description:
Write 1 to flush the cache. This clears the tag memory, but
 the data memory retains its contents. (This means cache-as-SRAM
 contents is not affected by flush or reset.)
 Reading will hold the bus (stall the processor) until the flush
 completes. Alternatively STAT can be polled until completion.
BitField.name: FLUSH

Register.description: Cache Status
Register.name: STAT

BitField.description: When 1, indicates the XIP streaming FIFO is completely full.\n The streaming FIFO is 2 entries deep, so the full and empty\n flag allow its level to be ascertained.
BitField.name: FIFO_FULL

BitField.description: When 1, indicates the XIP streaming FIFO is completely empty.
BitField.name: FIFO_EMPTY

BitField.description: Reads as 0 while a cache flush is in progress, and 1 otherwise.\n The cache is flushed whenever the XIP block is reset, and also\n when requested via the FLUSH register.
BitField.name: FLUSH_READY

Register.description:
Cache Hit counter
 A 32 bit saturating counter that increments upon each cache hit,
 i.e. when an XIP access is serviced directly from cached data.
 Write any value to clear.
Register.name: CTR_HIT

Register.description:
Cache Access counter
 A 32 bit saturating counter that increments upon each XIP access,
 whether the cache is hit or not. This includes noncacheable accesses.
 Write any value to clear.
Register.name: CTR_ACC

Register.description: FIFO stream address
Register.name: STREAM_ADDR

BitField.description: The address of the next word to be streamed from flash to the streaming FIFO.\n Increments automatically after each flash access.\n Write the initial access address here before starting a streaming read.
BitField.name: STREAM_ADDR

Register.description: FIFO stream control
Register.name: STREAM_CTR

BitField.description:
Write a nonzero value to start a streaming read. This will then
 progress in the background, using flash idle cycles to transfer
 a linear data block from flash to the streaming FIFO.
 Decrements automatically (1 at a time) as the stream
 progresses, and halts on reaching 0.
 Write 0 to halt an in-progress stream, and discard any in-flight
 read, so that a new stream can immediately be started (after
 draining the FIFO and reinitialising STREAM_ADDR)
BitField.name: STREAM_CTR

Register.description:
FIFO stream data
 Streamed data is buffered here, for retrieval by the system DMA.
 This FIFO can also be accessed via the XIP_AUX slave, to avoid exposing
 the DMA to bus stalls caused by other XIP traffic.
Register.name: STREAM_FIFO

RegisterGroup.description:
DW_apb_ssi has the following features:
 * APB interface Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Allows for easy integration into a DesignWare Synthesizable Components for AMBA 2 implementation.
 * APB3 and APB4 protocol support.
 * Scalable APB data bus width Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Supports APB data bus widths of 8, 16, and 32 bits.
 * Serial-master or serial-slave operation Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Enables serial communication with serial-master or serial-slave peripheral devices.
 * Programmable Dual/Quad/Octal SPI support in Master Mode.
 * Dual Data Rate (DDR) and Read Data Strobe (RDS) Support - Enables the DW_apb_ssi master to perform operations with the device in DDR and RDS modes when working in Dual/Quad/Octal mode of operation.
 * Data Mask Support - Enables the DW_apb_ssi to selectively update the bytes in the device. This feature is applicable only in enhanced SPI modes.
 * eXecute-In-Place (XIP) support - Enables the DW_apb_ssi master to behave as a memory mapped I/O and fetches the data from the device based on the APB read request. This feature is applicable only in enhanced SPI modes.
 * DMA Controller Interface Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Enables the DW_apb_ssi to interface to a DMA controller over the bus using a handshaking interface for transfer requests.
 * Independent masking of interrupts Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Master collision, transmit FIFO overflow, transmit FIFO empty, receive FIFO full, receive FIFO underflow, and receive FIFO overflow interrupts can all be masked independently.
 * Multi-master contention detection Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Informs the processor of multiple serial-master accesses on the serial bus.
 * Bypass of meta-stability flip-flops for synchronous clocks Ã¢â‚¬â€œ When the APB clock (pclk) and the DW_apb_ssi serial clock (ssi_clk) are synchronous, meta-stable flip-flops are not used when transferring control signals across these clock domains.
 * Programmable delay on the sample time of the received serial data bit (rxd); enables programmable control of routing delays resulting in higher serial data-bit rates.
 * Programmable features:
 - Serial interface operation Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Choice of Motorola SPI, Texas Instruments Synchronous Serial Protocol or National Semiconductor Microwire.
 - Clock bit-rate Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Dynamic control of the serial bit rate of the data transfer; used in only serial-master mode of operation.
 - Data Item size (4 to 32 bits) Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Item size of each data transfer under the control of the programmer.
 * Configured features:
 - FIFO depth Ã¢â‚¬â€œ 16 words deep. The FIFO width is fixed at 32 bits.
 - 1 slave select output.
 - Hardware slave-select Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Dedicated hardware slave-select line.
 - Combined interrupt line - one combined interrupt line from the DW_apb_ssi to the interrupt controller.
 - Interrupt polarity Ã¢â‚¬â€œ active high interrupt lines.
 - Serial clock polarity Ã¢â‚¬â€œ low serial-clock polarity directly after reset.
 - Serial clock phase Ã¢â‚¬â€œ capture on first edge of serial-clock directly after reset.
RegisterGroup.name: XIP_SSI

Register.description:
For each bit, if 1, bypass the input synchronizer between that GPIO
 and the GPIO input register in the SIO. The input synchronizers should
 generally be unbypassed, to avoid injecting metastabilities into processors.
 If you're feeling brave, you can bypass to save two cycles of input
 latency. This register applies to GPIO 0...29.
Register.name: PROC_IN_SYNC_BYPASS

Register.description:
For each bit, if 1, bypass the input synchronizer between that GPIO
 and the GPIO input register in the SIO. The input synchronizers should
 generally be unbypassed, to avoid injecting metastabilities into processors.
 If you're feeling brave, you can bypass to save two cycles of input
 latency. This register applies to GPIO 30...35 (the QSPI IOs).
Register.name: PROC_IN_SYNC_BYPASS_HI

BitField.name: DC50

BitField.description: Starts and stops the clock generator cleanly

BitField.description: Asynchronously kills the clock generator

BitField.description: Enable resus
BitField.name: ENABLE

BitField.description: This is expressed as a number of clk_ref cycles\n and must be >= 2x clk_ref_freq/min_clk_tst_freq
BitField.name: TIMEOUT

BitField.description: Clock has been resuscitated, correct the error then send ctrl_clear=1
BitField.name: RESUSSED

Register.description: Reference clock frequency in kHz
Register.name: FC0_REF_KHZ

Register.description: Minimum pass frequency in kHz. This is optional. Set to 0 if you are not using the pass/fail flags
Register.name: FC0_MIN_KHZ

Register.description: Maximum pass frequency in kHz. This is optional. Set to 0x1ffffff if you are not using the pass/fail flags
Register.name: FC0_MAX_KHZ

Register.description: Delays the start of frequency counting to allow the mux to settle\n Delay is measured in multiples of the reference clock period
Register.name: FC0_DELAY

Register.description: The test interval is 0.98us * 2**interval, but let's call it 1us * 2**interval\n The default gives a test interval of 250us
Register.name: FC0_INTERVAL

Register.description: Clock sent to frequency counter, set to 0 when not required\n Writing to this register initiates the frequency count
Register.name: FC0_SRC

Register.description: Frequency counter status
Register.name: FC0_STATUS

BitField.description: Test clock stopped during test
BitField.name: DIED

BitField.description: Test clock faster than expected, only valid when status_done=1
BitField.name: FAST

BitField.description: Test clock slower than expected, only valid when status_done=1
BitField.name: SLOW

BitField.description: Test failed
BitField.name: FAIL

BitField.description: Waiting for test clock to start
BitField.name: WAITING

BitField.description: Test running
BitField.name: RUNNING

BitField.description: Test complete
BitField.name: DONE

BitField.description: Test passed
BitField.name: PASS

Register.description: Result of frequency measurement, only valid when status_done=1
Register.name: FC0_RESULT

Register.description: enable clock in wake mode
Register.name: WAKE_EN0

Register.description: enable clock in wake mode
Register.name: WAKE_EN1

Register.description: enable clock in sleep mode
Register.name: SLEEP_EN0

Register.description: enable clock in sleep mode
Register.name: SLEEP_EN1

Register.description: indicates the state of the clock enable
Register.name: ENABLED0

Register.description: indicates the state of the clock enable
Register.name: ENABLED1

Register.description: Raw Interrupts
Register.name: INTR

Register.description: Interrupt Enable
Register.name: INTE

Register.description: Interrupt Force
Register.name: INTF

Register.description: Interrupt status after masking & forcing
Register.name: INTS

Register.description: Reset control. If a bit is set it means the peripheral is in reset. 0 means the peripheral's reset is deasserted.
Register.name: RESET

Register.description: Watchdog select. If a bit is set then the watchdog will reset this peripheral when the watchdog fires.
Register.name: WDSEL

Register.description: Reset done. If a bit is set then a reset done signal has been returned by the peripheral. This indicates that the peripheral's registers are ready to be accessed.
Register.name: RESET_DONE

Register.description: Force block out of reset (i.e. power it on)
Register.name: FRCE_ON

Register.description: Force into reset (i.e. power it off)
Register.name: FRCE_OFF

Register.description: Set to 1 if this peripheral should be reset when the watchdog fires.
Register.name: WDSEL

Register.description: Indicates the peripheral's registers are ready to access.
Register.name: DONE

Register.description: GPIO status
Register.name: GPIO0_STATUS

BitField.name: IRQTOPROC

BitField.description: interrupt from pad before override is applied
BitField.name: IRQFROMPAD

BitField.name: INTOPERI

BitField.description: input signal from pad, before override is applied
BitField.name: INFROMPAD

BitField.description: output enable to pad after register override is applied
BitField.name: OETOPAD

BitField.name: OEFROMPERI

BitField.description: output signal to pad after register override is applied
BitField.name: OUTTOPAD

BitField.description: output signal from selected peripheral, before register override is applied
BitField.name: OUTFROMPERI

Enum.name: INVERT

Register.description: Crystal Oscillator Control
Register.name: CTRL

BitField.description: On power-up this field is initialised to DISABLE and the chip runs from the ROSC.\n If the chip has subsequently been programmed to run from the XOSC then setting this field to DISABLE may lock-up the chip. If this is a concern then run the clk_ref from the ROSC and enable the clk_sys RESUS feature.\n The 12-bit code is intended to give some protection against accidental writes. An invalid setting will enable the oscillator.
BitField.name: ENABLE

BitField.description: Frequency range. This resets to 0xAA0 and cannot be changed.
BitField.name: FREQ_RANGE

Register.description: Crystal Oscillator Status
Register.name: STATUS

BitField.description: Oscillator is running and stable
BitField.name: STABLE

BitField.description: An invalid value has been written to CTRL_ENABLE or CTRL_FREQ_RANGE or DORMANT
BitField.name: BADWRITE

BitField.description: Oscillator is enabled but not necessarily running and stable, resets to 0
BitField.name: ENABLED

BitField.description: The current frequency range setting, always reads 0
BitField.name: FREQ_RANGE

Register.description:
Crystal Oscillator pause control
 This is used to save power by pausing the XOSC
 On power-up this field is initialised to WAKE
 An invalid write will also select WAKE
 WARNING: stop the PLLs before selecting dormant mode
 WARNING: setup the irq before selecting dormant mode
Register.name: DORMANT

Register.description: Controls the startup delay
Register.name: STARTUP

BitField.description: Multiplies the startup_delay by 4. This is of little value to the user given that the delay can be programmed directly
BitField.name: X4

BitField.description: in multiples of 256*xtal_period
BitField.name: DELAY

Register.description: A down counter running at the xosc frequency which counts to zero and stops.\n To start the counter write a non-zero value.\n Can be used for short software pauses when setting up time sensitive hardware.
Register.name: COUNT

Register.description:
Control and Status
 GENERAL CONSTRAINTS:
 Reference clock frequency min=5MHz, max=800MHz
 Feedback divider min=16, max=320
 VCO frequency min=400MHz, max=1600MHz
Register.name: CS

BitField.description: PLL is locked
BitField.name: LOCK

BitField.description: Passes the reference clock to the output instead of the divided VCO. The VCO continues to run so the user can switch between the reference clock and the divided VCO but the output will glitch when doing so.
BitField.name: BYPASS

BitField.description: Divides the PLL input reference clock.\n Behaviour is undefined for div=0.\n PLL output will be unpredictable during refdiv changes, wait for lock=1 before using it.
BitField.name: REFDIV

Register.description: Controls the PLL power modes.
Register.name: PWR

BitField.description: PLL VCO powerdown\n To save power set high when PLL output not required or bypass=1.
BitField.name: VCOPD

BitField.description: PLL post divider powerdown\n To save power set high when PLL output not required or bypass=1.
BitField.name: POSTDIVPD

BitField.description: PLL DSM powerdown\n Nothing is achieved by setting this low.
BitField.name: DSMPD

BitField.description: PLL powerdown\n To save power set high when PLL output not required.
BitField.name: PD

Register.description: Feedback divisor\n (note: this PLL does not support fractional division)
Register.name: FBDIV_INT

BitField.description: see ctrl reg description for constraints
BitField.name: FBDIV_INT

Register.description: Controls the PLL post dividers for the primary output\n (note: this PLL does not have a secondary output)\n the primary output is driven from VCO divided by postdiv1*postdiv2
Register.name: PRIM

BitField.description: divide by 1-7
BitField.name: POSTDIV1

BitField.description: divide by 1-7
BitField.name: POSTDIV2

Register.description:
Control and Status
 GENERAL CONSTRAINTS:
 Reference clock frequency min=5MHz, max=800MHz
 Feedback divider min=16, max=320
 VCO frequency min=400MHz, max=1600MHz
Register.name: CS

BitField.description: PLL is locked
BitField.name: LOCK

BitField.description: Passes the reference clock to the output instead of the divided VCO. The VCO continues to run so the user can switch between the reference clock and the divided VCO but the output will glitch when doing so.
BitField.name: BYPASS

BitField.description: Divides the PLL input reference clock.\n Behaviour is undefined for div=0.\n PLL output will be unpredictable during refdiv changes, wait for lock=1 before using it.
BitField.name: REFDIV

Register.description: Controls the PLL power modes.
Register.name: PWR

BitField.description: PLL VCO powerdown\n To save power set high when PLL output not required or bypass=1.
BitField.name: VCOPD

BitField.description: PLL post divider powerdown\n To save power set high when PLL output not required or bypass=1.
BitField.name: POSTDIVPD

BitField.description: PLL DSM powerdown\n Nothing is achieved by setting this low.
BitField.name: DSMPD

BitField.description: PLL powerdown\n To save power set high when PLL output not required.
BitField.name: PD

Register.description: Feedback divisor\n (note: this PLL does not support fractional division)
Register.name: FBDIV_INT

BitField.description: see ctrl reg description for constraints
BitField.name: FBDIV_INT

Register.description: Controls the PLL post dividers for the primary output\n (note: this PLL does not have a secondary output)\n the primary output is driven from VCO divided by postdiv1*postdiv2
Register.name: PRIM

BitField.description: divide by 1-7
BitField.name: POSTDIV1

BitField.description: divide by 1-7
BitField.name: POSTDIV2

RegisterGroup.description: Register block for busfabric control signals and performance counters
RegisterGroup.name: BUSCTRL

Register.description: Set the priority of each master for bus arbitration.
Register.name: BUS_PRIORITY

BitField.description: 0 - low priority, 1 - high priority
BitField.name: DMA_W

BitField.description: 0 - low priority, 1 - high priority
BitField.name: DMA_R

BitField.description: 0 - low priority, 1 - high priority
BitField.name: PROC1

BitField.description: 0 - low priority, 1 - high priority
BitField.name: PROC0

Register.description: Bus priority acknowledge
Register.name: BUS_PRIORITY_ACK

BitField.description: Goes to 1 once all arbiters have registered the new global priority levels.\n Arbiters update their local priority when servicing a new nonsequential access.\n In normal circumstances this will happen almost immediately.
BitField.name: BUS_PRIORITY_ACK

Register.description: Bus fabric performance counter 0
Register.name: PERFCTR0

BitField.description: Busfabric saturating performance counter 0\n Count some event signal from the busfabric arbiters.\n Write any value to clear. Select an event to count using PERFSEL0
BitField.name: PERFCTR0

Register.description: Bus fabric performance event select for PERFCTR0
Register.name: PERFSEL0

BitField.description: Select a performance event for PERFCTR0
BitField.name: PERFSEL0

Register.description: Bus fabric performance counter 1
Register.name: PERFCTR1

BitField.description: Busfabric saturating performance counter 1\n Count some event signal from the busfabric arbiters.\n Write any value to clear. Select an event to count using PERFSEL1
BitField.name: PERFCTR1

Register.description: Bus fabric performance event select for PERFCTR1
Register.name: PERFSEL1

BitField.description: Select a performance event for PERFCTR1
BitField.name: PERFSEL1

Register.description: Bus fabric performance counter 2
Register.name: PERFCTR2

BitField.description: Busfabric saturating performance counter 2\n Count some event signal from the busfabric arbiters.\n Write any value to clear. Select an event to count using PERFSEL2
BitField.name: PERFCTR2

Register.description: Bus fabric performance event select for PERFCTR2
Register.name: PERFSEL2

BitField.description: Select a performance event for PERFCTR2
BitField.name: PERFSEL2

Register.description: Bus fabric performance counter 3
Register.name: PERFCTR3

BitField.description: Busfabric saturating performance counter 3\n Count some event signal from the busfabric arbiters.\n Write any value to clear. Select an event to count using PERFSEL3
BitField.name: PERFCTR3

Register.description: Bus fabric performance event select for PERFCTR3
Register.name: PERFSEL3

BitField.description: Select a performance event for PERFCTR3
BitField.name: PERFSEL3

Register.description: Data Register, UARTDR
Register.name: UARTDR

BitField.description: Overrun error. This bit is set to 1 if data is received and the receive FIFO is already full. This is cleared to 0 once there is an empty space in the FIFO and a new character can be written to it.
BitField.name: OE

BitField.description: Break error. This bit is set to 1 if a break condition was detected, indicating that the received data input was held LOW for longer than a full-word transmission time (defined as start, data, parity and stop bits). In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO. When a break occurs, only one 0 character is loaded into the FIFO. The next character is only enabled after the receive data input goes to a 1 (marking state), and the next valid start bit is received.
BitField.name: BE

BitField.description: Parity error. When set to 1, it indicates that the parity of the received data character does not match the parity that the EPS and SPS bits in the Line Control Register, UARTLCR_H. In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO.
BitField.name: PE

BitField.description: Framing error. When set to 1, it indicates that the received character did not have a valid stop bit (a valid stop bit is 1). In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO.
BitField.name: FE

BitField.description: Receive (read) data character. Transmit (write) data character.
BitField.name: DATA

Register.description: Receive Status Register/Error Clear Register, UARTRSR/UARTECR
Register.name: UARTRSR

BitField.description: Overrun error. This bit is set to 1 if data is received and the FIFO is already full. This bit is cleared to 0 by a write to UARTECR. The FIFO contents remain valid because no more data is written when the FIFO is full, only the contents of the shift register are overwritten. The CPU must now read the data, to empty the FIFO.
BitField.name: OE

BitField.description: Break error. This bit is set to 1 if a break condition was detected, indicating that the received data input was held LOW for longer than a full-word transmission time (defined as start, data, parity, and stop bits). This bit is cleared to 0 after a write to UARTECR. In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO. When a break occurs, only one 0 character is loaded into the FIFO. The next character is only enabled after the receive data input goes to a 1 (marking state) and the next valid start bit is received.
BitField.name: BE

BitField.description: Parity error. When set to 1, it indicates that the parity of the received data character does not match the parity that the EPS and SPS bits in the Line Control Register, UARTLCR_H. This bit is cleared to 0 by a write to UARTECR. In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO.
BitField.name: PE

BitField.description: Framing error. When set to 1, it indicates that the received character did not have a valid stop bit (a valid stop bit is 1). This bit is cleared to 0 by a write to UARTECR. In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO.
BitField.name: FE

Register.description: Flag Register, UARTFR
Register.name: UARTFR

BitField.description: Ring indicator. This bit is the complement of the UART ring indicator, nUARTRI, modem status input. That is, the bit is 1 when nUARTRI is LOW.
BitField.name: RI

BitField.description: Transmit FIFO empty. The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the Line Control Register, UARTLCR_H. If the FIFO is disabled, this bit is set when the transmit holding register is empty. If the FIFO is enabled, the TXFE bit is set when the transmit FIFO is empty. This bit does not indicate if there is data in the transmit shift register.
BitField.name: TXFE

BitField.description: Receive FIFO full. The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the UARTLCR_H Register. If the FIFO is disabled, this bit is set when the receive holding register is full. If the FIFO is enabled, the RXFF bit is set when the receive FIFO is full.
BitField.name: RXFF

BitField.description: Transmit FIFO full. The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the UARTLCR_H Register. If the FIFO is disabled, this bit is set when the transmit holding register is full. If the FIFO is enabled, the TXFF bit is set when the transmit FIFO is full.
BitField.name: TXFF

BitField.description: Receive FIFO empty. The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the UARTLCR_H Register. If the FIFO is disabled, this bit is set when the receive holding register is empty. If the FIFO is enabled, the RXFE bit is set when the receive FIFO is empty.
BitField.name: RXFE

BitField.description: UART busy. If this bit is set to 1, the UART is busy transmitting data. This bit remains set until the complete byte, including all the stop bits, has been sent from the shift register. This bit is set as soon as the transmit FIFO becomes non-empty, regardless of whether the UART is enabled or not.
BitField.name: BUSY

BitField.description: Data carrier detect. This bit is the complement of the UART data carrier detect, nUARTDCD, modem status input. That is, the bit is 1 when nUARTDCD is LOW.
BitField.name: DCD

BitField.description: Data set ready. This bit is the complement of the UART data set ready, nUARTDSR, modem status input. That is, the bit is 1 when nUARTDSR is LOW.
BitField.name: DSR

BitField.description: Clear to send. This bit is the complement of the UART clear to send, nUARTCTS, modem status input. That is, the bit is 1 when nUARTCTS is LOW.
BitField.name: CTS

Register.description: IrDA Low-Power Counter Register, UARTILPR
Register.name: UARTILPR

BitField.description: 8-bit low-power divisor value. These bits are cleared to 0 at reset.
BitField.name: ILPDVSR

Register.description: Integer Baud Rate Register, UARTIBRD
Register.name: UARTIBRD

BitField.description: The integer baud rate divisor. These bits are cleared to 0 on reset.
BitField.name: BAUD_DIVINT

Register.description: Fractional Baud Rate Register, UARTFBRD
Register.name: UARTFBRD

BitField.description: The fractional baud rate divisor. These bits are cleared to 0 on reset.
BitField.name: BAUD_DIVFRAC

Register.description: Line Control Register, UARTLCR_H
Register.name: UARTLCR_H

BitField.description: Stick parity select. 0 = stick parity is disabled 1 = either: * if the EPS bit is 0 then the parity bit is transmitted and checked as a 1 * if the EPS bit is 1 then the parity bit is transmitted and checked as a 0. This bit has no effect when the PEN bit disables parity checking and generation.
BitField.name: SPS

BitField.description: Word length. These bits indicate the number of data bits transmitted or received in a frame as follows: b11 = 8 bits b10 = 7 bits b01 = 6 bits b00 = 5 bits.
BitField.name: WLEN

BitField.description: Enable FIFOs: 0 = FIFOs are disabled (character mode) that is, the FIFOs become 1-byte-deep holding registers 1 = transmit and receive FIFO buffers are enabled (FIFO mode).
BitField.name: FEN

BitField.description: Two stop bits select. If this bit is set to 1, two stop bits are transmitted at the end of the frame. The receive logic does not check for two stop bits being received.
BitField.name: STP2

BitField.description: Even parity select. Controls the type of parity the UART uses during transmission and reception: 0 = odd parity. The UART generates or checks for an odd number of 1s in the data and parity bits. 1 = even parity. The UART generates or checks for an even number of 1s in the data and parity bits. This bit has no effect when the PEN bit disables parity checking and generation.
BitField.name: EPS

BitField.description: Parity enable: 0 = parity is disabled and no parity bit added to the data frame 1 = parity checking and generation is enabled.
BitField.name: PEN

BitField.description: Send break. If this bit is set to 1, a low-level is continually output on the UARTTXD output, after completing transmission of the current character. For the proper execution of the break command, the software must set this bit for at least two complete frames. For normal use, this bit must be cleared to 0.
BitField.name: BRK

Register.description: Control Register, UARTCR
Register.name: UARTCR

BitField.description: CTS hardware flow control enable. If this bit is set to 1, CTS hardware flow control is enabled. Data is only transmitted when the nUARTCTS signal is asserted.
BitField.name: CTSEN

BitField.description: RTS hardware flow control enable. If this bit is set to 1, RTS hardware flow control is enabled. Data is only requested when there is space in the receive FIFO for it to be received.
BitField.name: RTSEN

BitField.description: This bit is the complement of the UART Out2 (nUARTOut2) modem status output. That is, when the bit is programmed to a 1, the output is 0. For DTE this can be used as Ring Indicator (RI).
BitField.name: OUT2

BitField.description: This bit is the complement of the UART Out1 (nUARTOut1) modem status output. That is, when the bit is programmed to a 1 the output is 0. For DTE this can be used as Data Carrier Detect (DCD).
BitField.name: OUT1

BitField.description: Request to send. This bit is the complement of the UART request to send, nUARTRTS, modem status output. That is, when the bit is programmed to a 1 then nUARTRTS is LOW.
BitField.name: RTS

BitField.description: Data transmit ready. This bit is the complement of the UART data transmit ready, nUARTDTR, modem status output. That is, when the bit is programmed to a 1 then nUARTDTR is LOW.
BitField.name: DTR

BitField.description: Receive enable. If this bit is set to 1, the receive section of the UART is enabled. Data reception occurs for either UART signals or SIR signals depending on the setting of the SIREN bit. When the UART is disabled in the middle of reception, it completes the current character before stopping.
BitField.name: RXE

BitField.description: Transmit enable. If this bit is set to 1, the transmit section of the UART is enabled. Data transmission occurs for either UART signals, or SIR signals depending on the setting of the SIREN bit. When the UART is disabled in the middle of transmission, it completes the current character before stopping.
BitField.name: TXE

BitField.description: Loopback enable. If this bit is set to 1 and the SIREN bit is set to 1 and the SIRTEST bit in the Test Control Register, UARTTCR is set to 1, then the nSIROUT path is inverted, and fed through to the SIRIN path. The SIRTEST bit in the test register must be set to 1 to override the normal half-duplex SIR operation. This must be the requirement for accessing the test registers during normal operation, and SIRTEST must be cleared to 0 when loopback testing is finished. This feature reduces the amount of external coupling required during system test. If this bit is set to 1, and the SIRTEST bit is set to 0, the UARTTXD path is fed through to the UARTRXD path. In either SIR mode or UART mode, when this bit is set, the modem outputs are also fed through to the modem inputs. This bit is cleared to 0 on reset, to disable loopback.
BitField.name: LBE

BitField.description: SIR low-power IrDA mode. This bit selects the IrDA encoding mode. If this bit is cleared to 0, low-level bits are transmitted as an active high pulse with a width of 3 / 16th of the bit period. If this bit is set to 1, low-level bits are transmitted with a pulse width that is 3 times the period of the IrLPBaud16 input signal, regardless of the selected bit rate. Setting this bit uses less power, but might reduce transmission distances.
BitField.name: SIRLP

BitField.description: SIR enable: 0 = IrDA SIR ENDEC is disabled. nSIROUT remains LOW (no light pulse generated), and signal transitions on SIRIN have no effect. 1 = IrDA SIR ENDEC is enabled. Data is transmitted and received on nSIROUT and SIRIN. UARTTXD remains HIGH, in the marking state. Signal transitions on UARTRXD or modem status inputs have no effect. This bit has no effect if the UARTEN bit disables the UART.
BitField.name: SIREN

BitField.description: UART enable: 0 = UART is disabled. If the UART is disabled in the middle of transmission or reception, it completes the current character before stopping. 1 = the UART is enabled. Data transmission and reception occurs for either UART signals or SIR signals depending on the setting of the SIREN bit.
BitField.name: UARTEN

Register.description: Interrupt FIFO Level Select Register, UARTIFLS
Register.name: UARTIFLS

BitField.description: Receive interrupt FIFO level select. The trigger points for the receive interrupt are as follows: b000 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 1 / 8 full b001 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 1 / 4 full b010 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 1 / 2 full b011 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 3 / 4 full b100 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 7 / 8 full b101-b111 = reserved.
BitField.name: RXIFLSEL

BitField.description: Transmit interrupt FIFO level select. The trigger points for the transmit interrupt are as follows: b000 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 1 / 8 full b001 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 1 / 4 full b010 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 1 / 2 full b011 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 3 / 4 full b100 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 7 / 8 full b101-b111 = reserved.
BitField.name: TXIFLSEL

Register.description: Interrupt Mask Set/Clear Register, UARTIMSC
Register.name: UARTIMSC

BitField.description: Overrun error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTOEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTOEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: OEIM

BitField.description: Break error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTBEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTBEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: BEIM

BitField.description: Parity error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTPEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTPEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: PEIM

BitField.description: Framing error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTFEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTFEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: FEIM

BitField.description: Receive timeout interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTRTINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTRTINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: RTIM

BitField.description: Transmit interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTTXINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTTXINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: TXIM

BitField.description: Receive interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTRXINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTRXINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: RXIM

BitField.description: nUARTDSR modem interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTDSRINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTDSRINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: DSRMIM

BitField.description: nUARTDCD modem interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTDCDINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTDCDINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: DCDMIM

BitField.description: nUARTCTS modem interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTCTSINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTCTSINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: CTSMIM

BitField.description: nUARTRI modem interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTRIINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTRIINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: RIMIM

Register.description: Raw Interrupt Status Register, UARTRIS
Register.name: UARTRIS

BitField.description: Overrun error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTOEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: OERIS

BitField.description: Break error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTBEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: BERIS

BitField.description: Parity error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTPEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: PERIS

BitField.description: Framing error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTFEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: FERIS

BitField.description: Receive timeout interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTRTINTR interrupt. a
BitField.name: RTRIS

BitField.description: Transmit interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTTXINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: TXRIS

BitField.description: Receive interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTRXINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RXRIS

BitField.description: nUARTDSR modem interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTDSRINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: DSRRMIS

BitField.description: nUARTDCD modem interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTDCDINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: DCDRMIS

BitField.description: nUARTCTS modem interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTCTSINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: CTSRMIS

BitField.description: nUARTRI modem interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTRIINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RIRMIS

Register.description: Masked Interrupt Status Register, UARTMIS
Register.name: UARTMIS

BitField.description: Overrun error masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTOEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: OEMIS

BitField.description: Break error masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTBEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: BEMIS

BitField.description: Parity error masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTPEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: PEMIS

BitField.description: Framing error masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTFEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: FEMIS

BitField.description: Receive timeout masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTRTINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RTMIS

BitField.description: Transmit masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTTXINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: TXMIS

BitField.description: Receive masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTRXINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RXMIS

BitField.description: nUARTDSR modem masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTDSRINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: DSRMMIS

BitField.description: nUARTDCD modem masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTDCDINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: DCDMMIS

BitField.description: nUARTCTS modem masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTCTSINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: CTSMMIS

BitField.description: nUARTRI modem masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTRIINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RIMMIS

Register.description: Interrupt Clear Register, UARTICR
Register.name: UARTICR

BitField.description: Overrun error interrupt clear. Clears the UARTOEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: OEIC

BitField.description: Break error interrupt clear. Clears the UARTBEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: BEIC

BitField.description: Parity error interrupt clear. Clears the UARTPEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: PEIC

BitField.description: Framing error interrupt clear. Clears the UARTFEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: FEIC

BitField.description: Receive timeout interrupt clear. Clears the UARTRTINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RTIC

BitField.description: Transmit interrupt clear. Clears the UARTTXINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: TXIC

BitField.description: Receive interrupt clear. Clears the UARTRXINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RXIC

BitField.description: nUARTDSR modem interrupt clear. Clears the UARTDSRINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: DSRMIC

BitField.description: nUARTDCD modem interrupt clear. Clears the UARTDCDINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: DCDMIC

BitField.description: nUARTCTS modem interrupt clear. Clears the UARTCTSINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: CTSMIC

BitField.description: nUARTRI modem interrupt clear. Clears the UARTRIINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RIMIC

Register.description: DMA Control Register, UARTDMACR
Register.name: UARTDMACR

BitField.description: DMA on error. If this bit is set to 1, the DMA receive request outputs, UARTRXDMASREQ or UARTRXDMABREQ, are disabled when the UART error interrupt is asserted.
BitField.name: DMAONERR

BitField.description: Transmit DMA enable. If this bit is set to 1, DMA for the transmit FIFO is enabled.
BitField.name: TXDMAE

BitField.description: Receive DMA enable. If this bit is set to 1, DMA for the receive FIFO is enabled.
BitField.name: RXDMAE

Register.description: UARTPeriphID0 Register
Register.name: UARTPERIPHID0

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x11
BitField.name: PARTNUMBER0

Register.description: UARTPeriphID1 Register
Register.name: UARTPERIPHID1

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x1
BitField.name: DESIGNER0

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x0
BitField.name: PARTNUMBER1

Register.description: UARTPeriphID2 Register
Register.name: UARTPERIPHID2

BitField.description: This field depends on the revision of the UART: r1p0 0x0 r1p1 0x1 r1p3 0x2 r1p4 0x2 r1p5 0x3
BitField.name: REVISION

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x4
BitField.name: DESIGNER1

Register.description: UARTPeriphID3 Register
Register.name: UARTPERIPHID3

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x00
BitField.name: CONFIGURATION

Register.description: UARTPCellID0 Register
Register.name: UARTPCELLID0

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x0D
BitField.name: UARTPCELLID0

Register.description: UARTPCellID1 Register
Register.name: UARTPCELLID1

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0xF0
BitField.name: UARTPCELLID1

Register.description: UARTPCellID2 Register
Register.name: UARTPCELLID2

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x05
BitField.name: UARTPCELLID2

Register.description: UARTPCellID3 Register
Register.name: UARTPCELLID3

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0xB1
BitField.name: UARTPCELLID3

Register.description: Data Register, UARTDR
Register.name: UARTDR

BitField.description: Overrun error. This bit is set to 1 if data is received and the receive FIFO is already full. This is cleared to 0 once there is an empty space in the FIFO and a new character can be written to it.
BitField.name: OE

BitField.description: Break error. This bit is set to 1 if a break condition was detected, indicating that the received data input was held LOW for longer than a full-word transmission time (defined as start, data, parity and stop bits). In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO. When a break occurs, only one 0 character is loaded into the FIFO. The next character is only enabled after the receive data input goes to a 1 (marking state), and the next valid start bit is received.

BitField.description: Parity error. When set to 1, it indicates that the parity of the received data character does not match the parity that the EPS and SPS bits in the Line Control Register, UARTLCR_H. In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO.
BitField.name: PE

BitField.description: Framing error. When set to 1, it indicates that the received character did not have a valid stop bit (a valid stop bit is 1). In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO.
BitField.name: FE

BitField.description: Receive (read) data character. Transmit (write) data character.
BitField.name: DATA

Register.description: Receive Status Register/Error Clear Register, UARTRSR/UARTECR
Register.name: UARTRSR

BitField.description: Overrun error. This bit is set to 1 if data is received and the FIFO is already full. This bit is cleared to 0 by a write to UARTECR. The FIFO contents remain valid because no more data is written when the FIFO is full, only the contents of the shift register are overwritten. The CPU must now read the data, to empty the FIFO.
BitField.name: OE

BitField.description: Break error. This bit is set to 1 if a break condition was detected, indicating that the received data input was held LOW for longer than a full-word transmission time (defined as start, data, parity, and stop bits). This bit is cleared to 0 after a write to UARTECR. In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO. When a break occurs, only one 0 character is loaded into the FIFO. The next character is only enabled after the receive data input goes to a 1 (marking state) and the next valid start bit is received.

BitField.description: Parity error. When set to 1, it indicates that the parity of the received data character does not match the parity that the EPS and SPS bits in the Line Control Register, UARTLCR_H. This bit is cleared to 0 by a write to UARTECR. In FIFO mode, this error is associated with the character at the top of the FIFO.

BitField.name: FE

Register.description: Flag Register, UARTFR
Register.name: UARTFR

BitField.description: Ring indicator. This bit is the complement of the UART ring indicator, nUARTRI, modem status input. That is, the bit is 1 when nUARTRI is LOW.
BitField.name: RI

BitField.description: Transmit FIFO empty. The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the Line Control Register, UARTLCR_H. If the FIFO is disabled, this bit is set when the transmit holding register is empty. If the FIFO is enabled, the TXFE bit is set when the transmit FIFO is empty. This bit does not indicate if there is data in the transmit shift register.
BitField.name: TXFE

BitField.description: Receive FIFO full. The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the UARTLCR_H Register. If the FIFO is disabled, this bit is set when the receive holding register is full. If the FIFO is enabled, the RXFF bit is set when the receive FIFO is full.
BitField.name: RXFF

BitField.description: Transmit FIFO full. The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the UARTLCR_H Register. If the FIFO is disabled, this bit is set when the transmit holding register is full. If the FIFO is enabled, the TXFF bit is set when the transmit FIFO is full.
BitField.name: TXFF

BitField.description: Receive FIFO empty. The meaning of this bit depends on the state of the FEN bit in the UARTLCR_H Register. If the FIFO is disabled, this bit is set when the receive holding register is empty. If the FIFO is enabled, the RXFE bit is set when the receive FIFO is empty.
BitField.name: RXFE

BitField.description: UART busy. If this bit is set to 1, the UART is busy transmitting data. This bit remains set until the complete byte, including all the stop bits, has been sent from the shift register. This bit is set as soon as the transmit FIFO becomes non-empty, regardless of whether the UART is enabled or not.
BitField.name: BUSY

BitField.description: Data carrier detect. This bit is the complement of the UART data carrier detect, nUARTDCD, modem status input. That is, the bit is 1 when nUARTDCD is LOW.
BitField.name: DCD

BitField.description: Data set ready. This bit is the complement of the UART data set ready, nUARTDSR, modem status input. That is, the bit is 1 when nUARTDSR is LOW.
BitField.name: DSR

BitField.description: Clear to send. This bit is the complement of the UART clear to send, nUARTCTS, modem status input. That is, the bit is 1 when nUARTCTS is LOW.
BitField.name: CTS

Register.description: IrDA Low-Power Counter Register, UARTILPR
Register.name: UARTILPR

BitField.description: 8-bit low-power divisor value. These bits are cleared to 0 at reset.
BitField.name: ILPDVSR

Register.description: Integer Baud Rate Register, UARTIBRD
Register.name: UARTIBRD

BitField.description: The integer baud rate divisor. These bits are cleared to 0 on reset.
BitField.name: BAUD_DIVINT

Register.description: Fractional Baud Rate Register, UARTFBRD
Register.name: UARTFBRD

BitField.description: The fractional baud rate divisor. These bits are cleared to 0 on reset.
BitField.name: BAUD_DIVFRAC

Register.description: Line Control Register, UARTLCR_H
Register.name: UARTLCR_H

BitField.description: Stick parity select. 0 = stick parity is disabled 1 = either: * if the EPS bit is 0 then the parity bit is transmitted and checked as a 1 * if the EPS bit is 1 then the parity bit is transmitted and checked as a 0. This bit has no effect when the PEN bit disables parity checking and generation.
BitField.name: SPS

BitField.description: Word length. These bits indicate the number of data bits transmitted or received in a frame as follows: b11 = 8 bits b10 = 7 bits b01 = 6 bits b00 = 5 bits.
BitField.name: WLEN

BitField.description: Enable FIFOs: 0 = FIFOs are disabled (character mode) that is, the FIFOs become 1-byte-deep holding registers 1 = transmit and receive FIFO buffers are enabled (FIFO mode).
BitField.name: FEN

BitField.description: Two stop bits select. If this bit is set to 1, two stop bits are transmitted at the end of the frame. The receive logic does not check for two stop bits being received.
BitField.name: STP2

BitField.description: Even parity select. Controls the type of parity the UART uses during transmission and reception: 0 = odd parity. The UART generates or checks for an odd number of 1s in the data and parity bits. 1 = even parity. The UART generates or checks for an even number of 1s in the data and parity bits. This bit has no effect when the PEN bit disables parity checking and generation.
BitField.name: EPS

BitField.description: Parity enable: 0 = parity is disabled and no parity bit added to the data frame 1 = parity checking and generation is enabled.
BitField.name: PEN

BitField.description: Send break. If this bit is set to 1, a low-level is continually output on the UARTTXD output, after completing transmission of the current character. For the proper execution of the break command, the software must set this bit for at least two complete frames. For normal use, this bit must be cleared to 0.
BitField.name: BRK

Register.description: Control Register, UARTCR
Register.name: UARTCR

BitField.description: CTS hardware flow control enable. If this bit is set to 1, CTS hardware flow control is enabled. Data is only transmitted when the nUARTCTS signal is asserted.
BitField.name: CTSEN

BitField.description: RTS hardware flow control enable. If this bit is set to 1, RTS hardware flow control is enabled. Data is only requested when there is space in the receive FIFO for it to be received.
BitField.name: RTSEN

BitField.description: This bit is the complement of the UART Out2 (nUARTOut2) modem status output. That is, when the bit is programmed to a 1, the output is 0. For DTE this can be used as Ring Indicator (RI).
BitField.name: OUT2

BitField.description: This bit is the complement of the UART Out1 (nUARTOut1) modem status output. That is, when the bit is programmed to a 1 the output is 0. For DTE this can be used as Data Carrier Detect (DCD).
BitField.name: OUT1

BitField.description: Request to send. This bit is the complement of the UART request to send, nUARTRTS, modem status output. That is, when the bit is programmed to a 1 then nUARTRTS is LOW.
BitField.name: RTS

BitField.description: Data transmit ready. This bit is the complement of the UART data transmit ready, nUARTDTR, modem status output. That is, when the bit is programmed to a 1 then nUARTDTR is LOW.
BitField.name: DTR

BitField.description: Receive enable. If this bit is set to 1, the receive section of the UART is enabled. Data reception occurs for either UART signals or SIR signals depending on the setting of the SIREN bit. When the UART is disabled in the middle of reception, it completes the current character before stopping.
BitField.name: RXE

BitField.description: Transmit enable. If this bit is set to 1, the transmit section of the UART is enabled. Data transmission occurs for either UART signals, or SIR signals depending on the setting of the SIREN bit. When the UART is disabled in the middle of transmission, it completes the current character before stopping.
BitField.name: TXE

BitField.description: Loopback enable. If this bit is set to 1 and the SIREN bit is set to 1 and the SIRTEST bit in the Test Control Register, UARTTCR is set to 1, then the nSIROUT path is inverted, and fed through to the SIRIN path. The SIRTEST bit in the test register must be set to 1 to override the normal half-duplex SIR operation. This must be the requirement for accessing the test registers during normal operation, and SIRTEST must be cleared to 0 when loopback testing is finished. This feature reduces the amount of external coupling required during system test. If this bit is set to 1, and the SIRTEST bit is set to 0, the UARTTXD path is fed through to the UARTRXD path. In either SIR mode or UART mode, when this bit is set, the modem outputs are also fed through to the modem inputs. This bit is cleared to 0 on reset, to disable loopback.
BitField.name: LBE

BitField.description: SIR low-power IrDA mode. This bit selects the IrDA encoding mode. If this bit is cleared to 0, low-level bits are transmitted as an active high pulse with a width of 3 / 16th of the bit period. If this bit is set to 1, low-level bits are transmitted with a pulse width that is 3 times the period of the IrLPBaud16 input signal, regardless of the selected bit rate. Setting this bit uses less power, but might reduce transmission distances.
BitField.name: SIRLP

BitField.description: SIR enable: 0 = IrDA SIR ENDEC is disabled. nSIROUT remains LOW (no light pulse generated), and signal transitions on SIRIN have no effect. 1 = IrDA SIR ENDEC is enabled. Data is transmitted and received on nSIROUT and SIRIN. UARTTXD remains HIGH, in the marking state. Signal transitions on UARTRXD or modem status inputs have no effect. This bit has no effect if the UARTEN bit disables the UART.
BitField.name: SIREN

BitField.description: UART enable: 0 = UART is disabled. If the UART is disabled in the middle of transmission or reception, it completes the current character before stopping. 1 = the UART is enabled. Data transmission and reception occurs for either UART signals or SIR signals depending on the setting of the SIREN bit.
BitField.name: UARTEN

Register.description: Interrupt FIFO Level Select Register, UARTIFLS
Register.name: UARTIFLS

BitField.description: Receive interrupt FIFO level select. The trigger points for the receive interrupt are as follows: b000 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 1 / 8 full b001 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 1 / 4 full b010 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 1 / 2 full b011 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 3 / 4 full b100 = Receive FIFO becomes >= 7 / 8 full b101-b111 = reserved.
BitField.name: RXIFLSEL

BitField.description: Transmit interrupt FIFO level select. The trigger points for the transmit interrupt are as follows: b000 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 1 / 8 full b001 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 1 / 4 full b010 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 1 / 2 full b011 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 3 / 4 full b100 = Transmit FIFO becomes <= 7 / 8 full b101-b111 = reserved.
BitField.name: TXIFLSEL

Register.description: Interrupt Mask Set/Clear Register, UARTIMSC
Register.name: UARTIMSC

BitField.description: Overrun error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTOEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTOEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: OEIM

BitField.description: Break error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTBEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTBEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: BEIM

BitField.description: Parity error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTPEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTPEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: PEIM

BitField.description: Framing error interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTFEINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTFEINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: FEIM

BitField.description: Receive timeout interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTRTINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTRTINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: RTIM

BitField.description: Transmit interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTTXINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTTXINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: TXIM

BitField.description: Receive interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTRXINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTRXINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: RXIM

BitField.description: nUARTDSR modem interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTDSRINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTDSRINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: DSRMIM

BitField.description: nUARTDCD modem interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTDCDINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTDCDINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: DCDMIM

BitField.description: nUARTCTS modem interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTCTSINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTCTSINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: CTSMIM

BitField.description: nUARTRI modem interrupt mask. A read returns the current mask for the UARTRIINTR interrupt. On a write of 1, the mask of the UARTRIINTR interrupt is set. A write of 0 clears the mask.
BitField.name: RIMIM

Register.description: Raw Interrupt Status Register, UARTRIS
Register.name: UARTRIS

BitField.description: Overrun error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTOEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: OERIS

BitField.description: Break error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTBEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: BERIS

BitField.description: Parity error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTPEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: PERIS

BitField.description: Framing error interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTFEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: FERIS

BitField.description: Receive timeout interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTRTINTR interrupt. a
BitField.name: RTRIS

BitField.description: Transmit interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTTXINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: TXRIS

BitField.description: Receive interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTRXINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RXRIS

BitField.description: nUARTDSR modem interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTDSRINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: DSRRMIS

BitField.description: nUARTDCD modem interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTDCDINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: DCDRMIS

BitField.description: nUARTCTS modem interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTCTSINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: CTSRMIS

BitField.description: nUARTRI modem interrupt status. Returns the raw interrupt state of the UARTRIINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RIRMIS

Register.description: Masked Interrupt Status Register, UARTMIS
Register.name: UARTMIS

BitField.description: Overrun error masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTOEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: OEMIS

BitField.description: Break error masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTBEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: BEMIS

BitField.description: Parity error masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTPEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: PEMIS

BitField.description: Framing error masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTFEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: FEMIS

BitField.description: Receive timeout masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTRTINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RTMIS

BitField.description: Transmit masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTTXINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: TXMIS

BitField.description: Receive masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTRXINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RXMIS

BitField.description: nUARTDSR modem masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTDSRINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: DSRMMIS

BitField.description: nUARTDCD modem masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTDCDINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: DCDMMIS

BitField.description: nUARTCTS modem masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTCTSINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: CTSMMIS

BitField.description: nUARTRI modem masked interrupt status. Returns the masked interrupt state of the UARTRIINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RIMMIS

Register.description: Interrupt Clear Register, UARTICR
Register.name: UARTICR

BitField.description: Overrun error interrupt clear. Clears the UARTOEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: OEIC

BitField.description: Break error interrupt clear. Clears the UARTBEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: BEIC

BitField.description: Parity error interrupt clear. Clears the UARTPEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: PEIC

BitField.description: Framing error interrupt clear. Clears the UARTFEINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: FEIC

BitField.description: Receive timeout interrupt clear. Clears the UARTRTINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RTIC

BitField.description: Transmit interrupt clear. Clears the UARTTXINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: TXIC

BitField.description: Receive interrupt clear. Clears the UARTRXINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RXIC

BitField.description: nUARTDSR modem interrupt clear. Clears the UARTDSRINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: DSRMIC

BitField.description: nUARTDCD modem interrupt clear. Clears the UARTDCDINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: DCDMIC

BitField.description: nUARTCTS modem interrupt clear. Clears the UARTCTSINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: CTSMIC

BitField.description: nUARTRI modem interrupt clear. Clears the UARTRIINTR interrupt.
BitField.name: RIMIC

Register.description: DMA Control Register, UARTDMACR
Register.name: UARTDMACR

BitField.description: DMA on error. If this bit is set to 1, the DMA receive request outputs, UARTRXDMASREQ or UARTRXDMABREQ, are disabled when the UART error interrupt is asserted.
BitField.name: DMAONERR

BitField.description: Transmit DMA enable. If this bit is set to 1, DMA for the transmit FIFO is enabled.
BitField.name: TXDMAE

BitField.description: Receive DMA enable. If this bit is set to 1, DMA for the receive FIFO is enabled.
BitField.name: RXDMAE

Register.description: UARTPeriphID0 Register
Register.name: UARTPERIPHID0

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x11
BitField.name: PARTNUMBER0

Register.description: UARTPeriphID1 Register
Register.name: UARTPERIPHID1

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x1
BitField.name: DESIGNER0

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x0
BitField.name: PARTNUMBER1

Register.description: UARTPeriphID2 Register
Register.name: UARTPERIPHID2

BitField.description: This field depends on the revision of the UART: r1p0 0x0 r1p1 0x1 r1p3 0x2 r1p4 0x2 r1p5 0x3
BitField.name: REVISION

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x4
BitField.name: DESIGNER1

Register.description: UARTPeriphID3 Register
Register.name: UARTPERIPHID3

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x00
BitField.name: CONFIGURATION

Register.description: UARTPCellID0 Register
Register.name: UARTPCELLID0

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x0D
BitField.name: UARTPCELLID0

Register.description: UARTPCellID1 Register
Register.name: UARTPCELLID1

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0xF0
BitField.name: UARTPCELLID1

Register.description: UARTPCellID2 Register
Register.name: UARTPCELLID2

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x05
BitField.name: UARTPCELLID2

Register.description: UARTPCellID3 Register
Register.name: UARTPCELLID3

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0xB1
BitField.name: UARTPCELLID3

Register.description: Control register 0, SSPCR0 on page 3-4
Register.name: SSPCR0

BitField.description: Serial clock rate. The value SCR is used to generate the transmit and receive bit rate of the PrimeCell SSP. The bit rate is: F SSPCLK CPSDVSR x (1+SCR) where CPSDVSR is an even value from 2-254, programmed through the SSPCPSR register and SCR is a value from 0-255.
BitField.name: SCR

BitField.description: SSPCLKOUT phase, applicable to Motorola SPI frame format only. See Motorola SPI frame format on page 2-10.
BitField.name: SPH

BitField.description: SSPCLKOUT polarity, applicable to Motorola SPI frame format only. See Motorola SPI frame format on page 2-10.
BitField.name: SPO

BitField.description: Frame format: 00 Motorola SPI frame format. 01 TI synchronous serial frame format. 10 National Microwire frame format. 11 Reserved, undefined operation.
BitField.name: FRF

BitField.description: Data Size Select: 0000 Reserved, undefined operation. 0001 Reserved, undefined operation. 0010 Reserved, undefined operation. 0011 4-bit data. 0100 5-bit data. 0101 6-bit data. 0110 7-bit data. 0111 8-bit data. 1000 9-bit data. 1001 10-bit data. 1010 11-bit data. 1011 12-bit data. 1100 13-bit data. 1101 14-bit data. 1110 15-bit data. 1111 16-bit data.
BitField.name: DSS

Register.description: Control register 1, SSPCR1 on page 3-5
Register.name: SSPCR1

BitField.description: Slave-mode output disable. This bit is relevant only in the slave mode, MS=1. In multiple-slave systems, it is possible for an PrimeCell SSP master to broadcast a message to all slaves in the system while ensuring that only one slave drives data onto its serial output line. In such systems the RXD lines from multiple slaves could be tied together. To operate in such systems, the SOD bit can be set if the PrimeCell SSP slave is not supposed to drive the SSPTXD line: 0 SSP can drive the SSPTXD output in slave mode. 1 SSP must not drive the SSPTXD output in slave mode.
BitField.name: SOD

BitField.description: Master or slave mode select. This bit can be modified only when the PrimeCell SSP is disabled, SSE=0: 0 Device configured as master, default. 1 Device configured as slave.
BitField.name: MS

BitField.description: Synchronous serial port enable: 0 SSP operation disabled. 1 SSP operation enabled.
BitField.name: SSE

BitField.description: Loop back mode: 0 Normal serial port operation enabled. 1 Output of transmit serial shifter is connected to input of receive serial shifter internally.
BitField.name: LBM

Register.description: Data register, SSPDR on page 3-6
Register.name: SSPDR

BitField.description: Transmit/Receive FIFO: Read Receive FIFO. Write Transmit FIFO. You must right-justify data when the PrimeCell SSP is programmed for a data size that is less than 16 bits. Unused bits at the top are ignored by transmit logic. The receive logic automatically right-justifies.
BitField.name: DATA

Register.description: Status register, SSPSR on page 3-7
Register.name: SSPSR

BitField.description: PrimeCell SSP busy flag, RO: 0 SSP is idle. 1 SSP is currently transmitting and/or receiving a frame or the transmit FIFO is not empty.
BitField.name: BSY

BitField.description: Receive FIFO full, RO: 0 Receive FIFO is not full. 1 Receive FIFO is full.
BitField.name: RFF

BitField.description: Receive FIFO not empty, RO: 0 Receive FIFO is empty. 1 Receive FIFO is not empty.
BitField.name: RNE

BitField.description: Transmit FIFO not full, RO: 0 Transmit FIFO is full. 1 Transmit FIFO is not full.
BitField.name: TNF

BitField.description: Transmit FIFO empty, RO: 0 Transmit FIFO is not empty. 1 Transmit FIFO is empty.
BitField.name: TFE

Register.description: Clock prescale register, SSPCPSR on page 3-8
Register.name: SSPCPSR

BitField.description: Clock prescale divisor. Must be an even number from 2-254, depending on the frequency of SSPCLK. The least significant bit always returns zero on reads.
BitField.name: CPSDVSR

Register.description: Interrupt mask set or clear register, SSPIMSC on page 3-9
Register.name: SSPIMSC

BitField.description: Transmit FIFO interrupt mask: 0 Transmit FIFO half empty or less condition interrupt is masked. 1 Transmit FIFO half empty or less condition interrupt is not masked.
BitField.name: TXIM

BitField.description: Receive FIFO interrupt mask: 0 Receive FIFO half full or less condition interrupt is masked. 1 Receive FIFO half full or less condition interrupt is not masked.
BitField.name: RXIM

BitField.description: Receive timeout interrupt mask: 0 Receive FIFO not empty and no read prior to timeout period interrupt is masked. 1 Receive FIFO not empty and no read prior to timeout period interrupt is not masked.
BitField.name: RTIM

BitField.description: Receive overrun interrupt mask: 0 Receive FIFO written to while full condition interrupt is masked. 1 Receive FIFO written to while full condition interrupt is not masked.
BitField.name: RORIM

Register.description: Raw interrupt status register, SSPRIS on page 3-10
Register.name: SSPRIS

BitField.description: Gives the raw interrupt state, prior to masking, of the SSPTXINTR interrupt
BitField.name: TXRIS

BitField.description: Gives the raw interrupt state, prior to masking, of the SSPRXINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RXRIS

BitField.description: Gives the raw interrupt state, prior to masking, of the SSPRTINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RTRIS

BitField.description: Gives the raw interrupt state, prior to masking, of the SSPRORINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RORRIS

Register.description: Masked interrupt status register, SSPMIS on page 3-11
Register.name: SSPMIS

BitField.description: Gives the transmit FIFO masked interrupt state, after masking, of the SSPTXINTR interrupt
BitField.name: TXMIS

BitField.description: Gives the receive FIFO masked interrupt state, after masking, of the SSPRXINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RXMIS

BitField.description: Gives the receive timeout masked interrupt state, after masking, of the SSPRTINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RTMIS

BitField.description: Gives the receive over run masked interrupt status, after masking, of the SSPRORINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RORMIS

Register.description: Interrupt clear register, SSPICR on page 3-11
Register.name: SSPICR

BitField.description: Clears the SSPRTINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RTIC

BitField.description: Clears the SSPRORINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RORIC

Register.description: DMA control register, SSPDMACR on page 3-12
Register.name: SSPDMACR

BitField.description: Transmit DMA Enable. If this bit is set to 1, DMA for the transmit FIFO is enabled.
BitField.name: TXDMAE

BitField.description: Receive DMA Enable. If this bit is set to 1, DMA for the receive FIFO is enabled.
BitField.name: RXDMAE

Register.description: Peripheral identification registers, SSPPeriphID0-3 on page 3-13
Register.name: SSPPERIPHID0

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x22
BitField.name: PARTNUMBER0

Register.description: Peripheral identification registers, SSPPeriphID0-3 on page 3-13
Register.name: SSPPERIPHID1

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x1
BitField.name: DESIGNER0

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x0
BitField.name: PARTNUMBER1

Register.description: Peripheral identification registers, SSPPeriphID0-3 on page 3-13
Register.name: SSPPERIPHID2

BitField.description: These bits return the peripheral revision
BitField.name: REVISION

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x4
BitField.name: DESIGNER1

Register.description: Peripheral identification registers, SSPPeriphID0-3 on page 3-13
Register.name: SSPPERIPHID3

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x00
BitField.name: CONFIGURATION

Register.description: PrimeCell identification registers, SSPPCellID0-3 on page 3-16
Register.name: SSPPCELLID0

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x0D
BitField.name: SSPPCELLID0

Register.description: PrimeCell identification registers, SSPPCellID0-3 on page 3-16
Register.name: SSPPCELLID1

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0xF0
BitField.name: SSPPCELLID1

Register.description: PrimeCell identification registers, SSPPCellID0-3 on page 3-16
Register.name: SSPPCELLID2

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0x05
BitField.name: SSPPCELLID2

Register.description: PrimeCell identification registers, SSPPCellID0-3 on page 3-16
Register.name: SSPPCELLID3

BitField.description: These bits read back as 0xB1
BitField.name: SSPPCELLID3

Register.description: Control register 0, SSPCR0 on page 3-4
Register.name: SSPCR0

BitField.description: Serial clock rate. The value SCR is used to generate the transmit and receive bit rate of the PrimeCell SSP. The bit rate is: F SSPCLK CPSDVSR x (1+SCR) where CPSDVSR is an even value from 2-254, programmed through the SSPCPSR register and SCR is a value from 0-255.
BitField.name: SCR

BitField.description: SSPCLKOUT phase, applicable to Motorola SPI frame format only. See Motorola SPI frame format on page 2-10.
BitField.name: SPH

BitField.description: SSPCLKOUT polarity, applicable to Motorola SPI frame format only. See Motorola SPI frame format on page 2-10.
BitField.name: SPO

BitField.description: Frame format: 00 Motorola SPI frame format. 01 TI synchronous serial frame format. 10 National Microwire frame format. 11 Reserved, undefined operation.
BitField.name: FRF

BitField.description: Data Size Select: 0000 Reserved, undefined operation. 0001 Reserved, undefined operation. 0010 Reserved, undefined operation. 0011 4-bit data. 0100 5-bit data. 0101 6-bit data. 0110 7-bit data. 0111 8-bit data. 1000 9-bit data. 1001 10-bit data. 1010 11-bit data. 1011 12-bit data. 1100 13-bit data. 1101 14-bit data. 1110 15-bit data. 1111 16-bit data.
BitField.name: DSS

Register.description: Control register 1, SSPCR1 on page 3-5
Register.name: SSPCR1

BitField.description: Slave-mode output disable. This bit is relevant only in the slave mode, MS=1. In multiple-slave systems, it is possible for an PrimeCell SSP master to broadcast a message to all slaves in the system while ensuring that only one slave drives data onto its serial output line. In such systems the RXD lines from multiple slaves could be tied together. To operate in such systems, the SOD bit can be set if the PrimeCell SSP slave is not supposed to drive the SSPTXD line: 0 SSP can drive the SSPTXD output in slave mode. 1 SSP must not drive the SSPTXD output in slave mode.
BitField.name: SOD

BitField.description: Master or slave mode select. This bit can be modified only when the PrimeCell SSP is disabled, SSE=0: 0 Device configured as master, default. 1 Device configured as slave.
BitField.name: MS

BitField.description: Synchronous serial port enable: 0 SSP operation disabled. 1 SSP operation enabled.
BitField.name: SSE

BitField.description: Loop back mode: 0 Normal serial port operation enabled. 1 Output of transmit serial shifter is connected to input of receive serial shifter internally.
BitField.name: LBM

Register.description: Data register, SSPDR on page 3-6
Register.name: SSPDR

BitField.description: Transmit/Receive FIFO: Read Receive FIFO. Write Transmit FIFO. You must right-justify data when the PrimeCell SSP is programmed for a data size that is less than 16 bits. Unused bits at the top are ignored by transmit logic. The receive logic automatically right-justifies.
BitField.name: DATA

Register.description: Status register, SSPSR on page 3-7
Register.name: SSPSR

BitField.description: PrimeCell SSP busy flag, RO: 0 SSP is idle. 1 SSP is currently transmitting and/or receiving a frame or the transmit FIFO is not empty.
BitField.name: BSY

BitField.description: Receive FIFO full, RO: 0 Receive FIFO is not full. 1 Receive FIFO is full.
BitField.name: RFF

BitField.description: Receive FIFO not empty, RO: 0 Receive FIFO is empty. 1 Receive FIFO is not empty.
BitField.name: RNE

BitField.description: Transmit FIFO not full, RO: 0 Transmit FIFO is full. 1 Transmit FIFO is not full.
BitField.name: TNF

BitField.description: Transmit FIFO empty, RO: 0 Transmit FIFO is not empty. 1 Transmit FIFO is empty.
BitField.name: TFE

Register.description: Clock prescale register, SSPCPSR on page 3-8
Register.name: SSPCPSR

BitField.description: Clock prescale divisor. Must be an even number from 2-254, depending on the frequency of SSPCLK. The least significant bit always returns zero on reads.
BitField.name: CPSDVSR

Register.description: Interrupt mask set or clear register, SSPIMSC on page 3-9
Register.name: SSPIMSC

BitField.description: Transmit FIFO interrupt mask: 0 Transmit FIFO half empty or less condition interrupt is masked. 1 Transmit FIFO half empty or less condition interrupt is not masked.
BitField.name: TXIM

BitField.description: Receive FIFO interrupt mask: 0 Receive FIFO half full or less condition interrupt is masked. 1 Receive FIFO half full or less condition interrupt is not masked.
BitField.name: RXIM

BitField.description: Receive timeout interrupt mask: 0 Receive FIFO not empty and no read prior to timeout period interrupt is masked. 1 Receive FIFO not empty and no read prior to timeout period interrupt is not masked.
BitField.name: RTIM

BitField.description: Receive overrun interrupt mask: 0 Receive FIFO written to while full condition interrupt is masked. 1 Receive FIFO written to while full condition interrupt is not masked.
BitField.name: RORIM

Register.description: Raw interrupt status register, SSPRIS on page 3-10
Register.name: SSPRIS

BitField.description: Gives the raw interrupt state, prior to masking, of the SSPTXINTR interrupt
BitField.name: TXRIS

BitField.description: Gives the raw interrupt state, prior to masking, of the SSPRXINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RXRIS

BitField.description: Gives the raw interrupt state, prior to masking, of the SSPRTINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RTRIS

BitField.description: Gives the raw interrupt state, prior to masking, of the SSPRORINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RORRIS

Register.description: Masked interrupt status register, SSPMIS on page 3-11
Register.name: SSPMIS

BitField.description: Gives the transmit FIFO masked interrupt state, after masking, of the SSPTXINTR interrupt
BitField.name: TXMIS

BitField.description: Gives the receive FIFO masked interrupt state, after masking, of the SSPRXINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RXMIS

BitField.description: Gives the receive timeout masked interrupt state, after masking, of the SSPRTINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RTMIS

BitField.description: Gives the receive over run masked interrupt status, after masking, of the SSPRORINTR interrupt
BitField.name: RORMIS

Register.description: Interrupt clear register, SSPICR on page 3-11
Register.name: SSPICR

BitField.description: Clears the SSPRTINTR interrupt
